Hello,
My iPhone 13 is experiencing the following problem:
Device was delivered damaged
Thank you for your help,

Hello ecomobile,

The customer claims that their device was delivered damaged. We have requested pictures of the outside of the package (with damages visible), a picture of the package label with the tracking number visible, a picture of the package showing the item inside, pictures of the packaging of the item received, and pictures of the damaged item (with damages visible) report.

Once we have all of the paperwork we’ll let you know if the customer prefers a refund or a reshipment. The deadline is 1 business day after we've received the documents.

All the best,
Tiana-Rijamalala, Back Market Customer Care

Dear Backcare,

The parcel was delivered on 04/05/2024, and the customer only complained that the device was damaged on 21/05/2024, thus it is highly unlikely that the device was delivered damaged as the customer claimed. The device is visibly cracked according to the customer's picture, which indicates that the device has been dropped or has suffered damage. The device is hence out of warranty and we are unable to issue a repair/refund. Please assist the customer and kindly close the case if no further assistance is required.

Regards,
YR

Dear ecomobile,

I have taken note of your message and thank you for it.

However, we have been informed that the customer has 14 working days following receipt of the parcel to report the problem.

I will get back to you as soon as I have the photos and documents needed to carry out the investigation.

Thank you for your understanding and have a nice day.

Regards,
Tiana-Rijamalala from the Back Care Team

Dear Backcare,

May we know who informed that the customer has 14 working days following receipt of the parcel to report the problem? During the 17 days usage, it is likely that the customer dropped the device, causing it to suffer damage, become broken and hence out of warranty. It is unreasonable to blame the seller or carrier for this issue. 

Regards,
SY

Dear ecomobile,

I have taken note of your message and thank you for it.

Further to your request, I would like to apologise for the confusion. I thought it was a BackShip label.

Please disregard my previous message.

Regards,
Tiana-Rijamalala from the Back Care Team

Dear Backcare,

We take note of your message.

Regards,
JH

Hi ecomobile,

Thanks for your help in keeping our shared customers happy!

Anthonia Back Market customer Care
